children.name: hr_ActivitySet()
children.text: Instantiates an instance of the hr_ActivitySet class.

children.name: hrService
children.text2:
Sys ID of HR service in the HR Services [sn_hr_core_service] table to be
                assigned to the lifecycle event case.

children.name: Example
children.text: var caseValues = { ‘subject_person’: ‘62826bf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5df1’, ‘opened_for’: ‘0e826bf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5d7c’, ‘subject_person_job’: ‘f8d56900587d3700964f4efae452b3db’, ‘location’: ‘25ab9d1d0a0a0bb300537fd25687439d’, ‘department’: ‘93b25282c0a8000b0b55c8ab34e2f1e6’, ‘subject_person_hr_profile’: ‘330370019f22120047a2d126c42e7012’, ‘short_description’: ‘Short description’, ‘state’: 10 }; var activity = new sn_hr_le.hr_ActivitySet(); var createCase = new activity.createLECaseByService(‘4719647c67a60300132a6c3b5685ef16’, caseValues);
children.text2:
Output includes summary with Operation Table and Row Count columns. Click the link in the
        row count column adjacent sn_hr_le_case table to view the new case.

children.name: String
children.text:
Sys ID of the created case in the HR Lifecycle Events Cases [sn_hr_le_case]
                table.

children.name: caseValues
children.text2: Key-value pairs containing a value for each case field.

children.name: caseValues.subject_person
children.text2: Sys ID of subject person's name in the User [sys_user] table.

children.name: caseValues.opened_for
children.text2: Sys ID of case opened for subject person in the Users [sys_user] table.

children.name: caseValues.subject_person_job
children.text2:
Sys ID of subject person's Business title in the Jobs [sn_hr_core_job]
                table.

children.name: caseValues.location
children.text2:
Sys ID of subject person's location in HR profile in the Locations
                [cmn_location] table.

children.name: caseValues.department
children.text2:
Sys ID of subject person's department in HR profile in the Departments
                [cmn_department] table.

children.name: caseValues.subject_person_hr_profile
children.text2:
Sys ID of subject person's HR profile in the HR Profiles [sn_hr_core_profile]
                table.

children.name: caseValues.state
children.text2: Number representing uniquely-defined custom case state.

children.name: createLECaseByService(String hrService, Object caseValues)
children.text: Creates a lifecycle event case based on a specified HR service.

children.name: Output
children.text: sn_hr_le: User has an active HR case: false

children.name: Example
children.text: var userId = '62826bf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5df1'; //Abel Tuter var hrServiceId = '64fa4c53534222003066a5f4a11c0875'; //Onboarding HR Service var jobId = '3D62826bf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5df1'; // Sample Job sys_id for the example var activity = new sn_hr_le.hr_ActivitySet(); var hasActiveLECase = activity.hasActiveCaseByService(userId, hrServiceId, jobId); gs.info('User has an active HR case: ' + hasActiveLECase);

children.name: spUser
children.text2: Sys ID of subject person user in the Users [sys_user] table.

children.name: Boolean
children.text: True if matching case exists, false otherwise.

children.name: hrService
children.text2: Sys ID of HR service in the HR Services [sn_hr_core_service] table.

children.name: jobId
children.text2:
Sys ID of subject user's job title in the HR Services [sn_hr_core_service]
                table.

children.name: hasActiveCaseByService(String spUser, String hrService, String jobId)
children.text:
Checks for a case matching the specified combination of subject person user, HR
    service, and job.

name: hr_ActivitySet
text: Handles lifecycle event activity set cases.
text2:
Lifecycle event activity sets represent different stages in the lifecycle event process. You must define when the activity set is triggered, such as immediately upon creation of the lifecycle event case or after the completion of another activity set. Each activity set is associated with a single lifecycle event.

The hr_ActivitySet API requires the HR Lifecycle Events plugin (com.sn_hr_lifecycle_events).

See also Understanding Enterprise Onboarding and Transitions.

children.name: Object
children.text: New case in related table, varies by product.

children.name: Example
children.text2:
This method is intended to be called as-is to create a producer and does not require
        supplying data.

children.name: current
children.text2: GlideRecord for case to be created.

children.name: producer
children.text2:
Comma-separated key value pair containing data as questions and answers that
                are automatically provided when a user submits an answer to a record producer
                question.

children.name: cat_item.sys_id
children.text2:
Looks up the HR service of case being created and variable names to populate
                the description.

children.name: createCaseFromProducer(GlideRecord current, Object producer, String cat_item.sys_id)
children.text:
Creates a case from a record producer and service. This method is intended to be called
    as-is to create a producer and does not require supplying data.
children.text2:
The following variables can be configured in a record producer to provide additional capabilities as follows:

  • job – References sn_hr_core_job and maps to subject_person_job in an HR case
  • opened_for – References sys_user and maps opened_for in an HR case
  • concurrent_job – If the record producer includes this variable (by activating checkbox) and parameters have job information, creates a new job in sn_hr_core_job table

name: hr_ActivityUtils
text: Enables creating HR cases from a record producer.
text2:
The hr_ActivityUtils script include requires the HR Lifecycle Events plugin
      (com.sn_hr_lifecycle_events).
